intro: Labordia hymenopoda, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Labordia hymenopoda is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered an important species for local pollinators.
